summary: This document is a chain of emails from September 2019 between an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York and attorney Javier A. Solano regarding a potential proffer session with his client, Santos Felix, concerning the Epstein matter. The emails discuss scheduling, an ICE detainer, and whether the government is still interested in interviewing Santos Felix.

persons.name: Javier A. Solano
persons.context: Attorney representing Santos Felix, communicating with the U.S. Attorney's Office to schedule a proffer session regarding the Epstein matter and inquiring about an ICE detainer.

persons.name: Santos Felix
persons.context: Client of Javier A. Solano; the subject of discussion regarding a potential proffer session with the government on the Epstein matter and the status of an immigration hold.

connections.description: Solano is the legal representative for Santos Felix, arranging a proffer session with prosecutors and inquiring about his immigration status.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Session
events.description: A proffer session with Santos Felix was scheduled for 2:00 p.m. at the U.S. Attorney's Office, with prosecutors present.

events.title: Rescheduled Proffer Session
events.description: A proffer session was rescheduled to Tuesday afternoon (likely September 3) due to a jury deliberation in another case.

events.title: Government Interest Inquiry
events.description: Attorney Javier A. Solano inquires if the government is still interested in interviewing Santos Felix regarding the Epstein matter, and the AUSA confirms they are not at that time.

locations: Law Offices of Javier A. Solano, PLLC
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was, as of September 2019, arranging a proffer session with Santos Felix regarding the Epstein matter.
Santos Felix had an ICE detainer, and his attorney was checking if it was lifted to consider a bail application.
By September 12, 2019, the government indicated it was no longer interested in further interviewing Santos Felix on the Epstein matter.
The communications show coordination between defense counsel and prosecutors for a proffer, a common step in federal investigations.
